page.title: 10RIVER NIDD
page.content: The river{NIDD}has its source at{GREAT {WHERNSIDE}.There is a weir in {HUNSINGORE}near a water mill,but the mill is not in use now.There is a bridge here too.Before the first bridge was built there was a ford.Then there was a wooden bridge that fell down and about 5 years ago the new one was built.There are trout put into the river upstream from{HUNSINGORE. There are lots of other fish (mainly coarse fish) like chub,dace,pike and perch,gudgeon,minnows and lots of other kinds. On one side of the river the fishing rights are owned by an angling club called Bradford No.1 and on the other side by Harrogate.In winter there is an island in the river but on one side in summer it dries up.The river goes down to Nun Monkton where it joins another river and changes its name from{Nidd}to Ouse.
